title: Primary Dealers Awarded Record Low Share of US 30-Year Auction
description: This market development indicates significant shifts in financial sentiment and trading patterns. Primary Dealers Awarded Record Low Share of US 30-Year Auction reflects economic forces that could influence investor behavior and market stability. The implications extend to both domestic and international financial markets.
content: The US Treasury building in Washington. A record low share of Thursday’s monthly auction of 30-year Treasury bonds was awarded to major US bond dealers, deepening a two-decade slide. Primary dealers — designated by the Federal Reserve and expected to bid in all Treasury auctions — were awarded 8.7% of the $22 billion auction for their own accounts, the lowest in data going back to 2006. The previous low was 9%, notched on two occasions in 2023.

content: France’s economic growth was resilient in recent months despite heightened political uncertainty weighing on business leaders, the country’s central bank said. The economy probably expanded around 0.3% in the third quarter, the Bank of France said in its monthly economic survey. That matches the previous forecast and would maintain the pace seen in the April-June period. Activity continued to advance in services and industry in September, while it eased in construction, according to the report.

description: This business development signals important shifts in market dynamics. content: The Telangana High Court on Thursday stayed the government notification on Backward Classes (BC) reservations in local body elections. The hearing on BC reservations has concluded, and the court stayed GO No. 9, which had granted 42 per cent reservation to BCs in local body polls. The court directed the Telangana government to file a counter affidavit within four weeks. The petitioners have been given two weeks thereafter to submit their replies.

content: The Karnataka government on Thursday approved “Menstrual Leave Policy, 2025” to ensure the well-being of women employees and promote workplace inclusivity. Under the policy, women will be entitled to one paid leave per month during menstruation. The government has officially announced the policy, which is now in effect.
